definitions.definition: Not admitting ecclesiastical dispensation ; not subject to release or exemption ; that cannot be allowed by bending the canonical rules.
Unbendable , that cannot be set aside or ignored.
Absolutely necessary or requisite ; that one cannot do without.
examples: An indispensable component of a heart-healthy diet.

main_definition: ( ecclesiastical , obsolete ) Not admitting ecclesiastical dispensation ; not subject to release or exemption ; that cannot be allowed by bending the canonical rules. [16th–17th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( of duties, rules etc. ) Unbendable , that cannot be set aside or ignored. [from 17th c.]
Absolutely necessary or requisite ; that one cannot do without. [from 17th c.]
